definition: lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
bill/list/form/single/only/sole/odd number/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Shan
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
surname Qiang
classifier for horses, mules etc/Taiwan pr. [pi1]/ordinary person/classifier for cloth: bolt/horsepower
mate/one of a pair
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: It took courage to sail the Atlantic singlehanded .
sentences.chinese: 單槍匹馬駛向大西洋需要很大的勇氣。

sentences.english: When investing in a business, he always likes to play a lone hand.
sentences.chinese: 在投資時，他總喜歡單槍匹馬的去幹。

sentences.english: Two time thorough hostile camp's results are single-handedly are encircled.
sentences.chinese: 兩次單槍匹馬深入敵營的結果都是被圍剿。

sentences.english: The scout single-handedly penetrated behind the enemy's rear lines.
sentences.chinese: 偵察員單槍匹馬深入敵後。

sentences.english: Anakin continued to hold his own alone, urged to the offensive by Palpatine's goading.
sentences.chinese: 阿納金單槍匹馬，在帕爾帕廷的煽動下佔據了上風。

sentences.english: China is single-handedly building post-American world economy.
sentences.chinese: 中國單槍匹馬地建立起了後美國時代的經濟啊。

sentences.english: I was alone and surrounded and I beat them.
sentences.chinese: 我單槍匹馬被圍剿，但我打敗了他們。

sentences.english: America cannot rescue the world economy alone.
sentences.chinese: 美國不可能單槍匹馬拯救世界經濟。

sentences.english: One cannot have done it single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不可能單槍匹馬做成這見事的。

sentences.english: There’s no country, I think, who can single-handedly tackle this challenge.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，沒有任何國家可以單槍匹馬地應付這一挑戰。

sentences.english: Negroponte won't have to fight alone.
sentences.chinese: 內格羅蓬特不必單槍匹馬地進行鬥爭。

sentences.english: If you want to play the game well, you have to play with others. You cannot play single-handed and win.
sentences.chinese: 要想贏球，必須同別人合作，不可能靠單槍匹馬取勝。

definition: to be drowned (figurative and literal)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
aggressive/truculent/overbearing
long-range raid
to be determined to win (idiom)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
to charge and break through enemy lines
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to fight with all one's might
